Yes, South Africa can get quite hot, particularly during the summer months (December-February). Here are some tips for staying cool while exploring the cities:

1. Dress for the weather: Wear light-colored and lightweight clothing made of breathable fabric like cotton or linen.

2. Wear sunscreen: Protect your skin from the sun by applying sunscreen with at least SPF 30.

3. Stay hydrated: Drink plenty of water and carry a reusable water bottle with you.

4. Take breaks: Take frequent breaks in a shady spot or air-conditioned store to cool down.

5. Plan your activities: Plan your activities for the cooler parts of the day, such as early morning or late afternoon.

6. Use air-conditioning: Stay in accommodation with air-conditioning or visit shopping malls, movie theaters, or museums that have air-conditioning.

7. Avoid alcohol: Avoid alcohol as it can dehydrate you and make you more susceptible to heat exhaustion.

By following these tips, you can stay comfortable and enjoy all the exciting activities South Africa has to offer.
